Cache#

File-based caching for PDF extractions.

papercutter.cache.hash.file_hash(path, chunk_size=1048576)[source]#

Generate a hash for a file based on content and metadata.

Uses MD5 of the first chunk + file size + modification time. This provides fast hashing while still detecting changes.

Parameters:

  • path (Path) – Path to the file.

  • chunk_size (int) – Bytes to read for hashing (default 1MB).

Return type:

str

Returns:

Hex string hash (12 characters).

class papercutter.cache.store.CacheStore[source]#

File-based cache for PDF extraction results.

Cache structure:

~/.cache/papercutter/ ├── <hash>/ │ ├── index.json # Document index │ ├── pages/ │ │ ├── 001-005.txt # Page range text │ │ └── 010-014.txt │ ├── tables/ │ │ └── table_3.json │ └── figures/ │ └── fig_1.png

__init__(cache_dir=None)[source]#

Initialize the cache store.

Parameters:

cache_dir (Optional[Path]) – Cache directory path. Defaults to ~/.cache/papercutter/

get_cache_path(pdf_path)[source]#

Get the cache directory for a PDF file.

Parameters:

pdf_path (Path) – Path to the PDF file.

Return type:

Path

Returns:

Path to the cache directory for this file.

has_cache(pdf_path)[source]#

Check if a PDF has cached data.

Parameters:

pdf_path (Path) – Path to the PDF file.

Return type:

bool

Returns:

True if cache exists for this file.

has_index(pdf_path)[source]#

Check if index is cached.

Parameters:

pdf_path (Path) – Path to the PDF file.

Return type:

bool

Returns:

True if index.json exists in cache.

get_index(pdf_path)[source]#

Get cached index for a PDF.

Parameters:

pdf_path (Path) – Path to the PDF file.

Return type:

Optional[dict[str, Any]]

Returns:

Index dict or None if not cached.

set_index(pdf_path, index)[source]#

Cache index for a PDF.

Uses atomic write (temp file + rename) to prevent corruption.

Parameters:

  • pdf_path (Path) – Path to the PDF file.

  • index (dict[str, Any]) – Index dict to cache.

Return type:

None

has_pages(pdf_path, start, end)[source]#

Check if page range is cached.

Parameters:

  • pdf_path (Path) – Path to the PDF file.

  • start (int) – Start page (1-indexed).

  • end (int) – End page (1-indexed, inclusive).

Return type:

bool

Returns:

True if this page range is cached.

get_pages(pdf_path, start, end)[source]#

Get cached text for a page range.

Parameters:

  • pdf_path (Path) – Path to the PDF file.

  • start (int) – Start page (1-indexed).

  • end (int) – End page (1-indexed, inclusive).

Return type:

Optional[str]

Returns:

Cached text or None if not cached.

set_pages(pdf_path, start, end, text)[source]#

Cache text for a page range.

Parameters:

  • pdf_path (Path) – Path to the PDF file.

  • start (int) – Start page (1-indexed).

  • end (int) – End page (1-indexed, inclusive).

  • text (str) – Text content to cache.

Return type:

None

get_equation_latex(pdf_path, equation_id)[source]#

Get cached LaTeX conversion for equation.

Parameters:

  • pdf_path (Path) – Path to the PDF file.

  • equation_id (int) – Equation ID.

Return type:

Optional[dict[str, Any]]

Returns:

LaTeX dict or None if not cached.

set_equation_latex(pdf_path, equation_id, latex_data)[source]#

Cache LaTeX conversion for equation.

Uses atomic write to prevent corruption.

Parameters:

  • pdf_path (Path) – Path to the PDF file.

  • equation_id (int) – Equation ID.

  • latex_data (dict[str, Any]) – LaTeX conversion dict to cache.

Return type:

None

clear(pdf_path=None)[source]#

Clear cache.

Parameters:

pdf_path (Optional[Path]) – If provided, clear cache for this file only. If None, clear entire cache.

Return type:

None

cache_info(pdf_path)[source]#

Get cache info for a PDF.

Uses efficient single-pass directory iteration instead of multiple globs.

Parameters:

pdf_path (Path) – Path to the PDF file.

Return type:

dict[str, Any]

Returns:

Dict with cache status info.

Parameters:

cache_dir (Optional[str]) – Optional cache directory path.

Return type:

CacheStore

Returns:

CacheStore instance.
